department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: blue underglaze floral motif; light grey glaze
medium:
Sawankalok ware
Stoneware with painted iron-oxide decor under a clear glaze
text: Underglaze iron decorated wares are a chief glory of the Sawankalok kilns. The painting is generally free and lively and popular motifs included flowers, fish, and the <I>cakra<I> or solar wheel. It is possible that the impetus for underglaze iron painting came from Chinese blue and white ware of the early 14th century.
title: Bowl
